New Records: The 30-point defeat marks the largest margin of loss in a season opener in franchise history for the Toronto Raptors, surpassing the previous record of 29 points set in their 2001 season opener against Orlando.
Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers rallied with a 13-5 run to take a 33-32 lead at the end of the first quarter and never trailed again.
The Cavaliers widened their lead to 69-49 by halftime and to 26 points by the end of the third quarter.
Scottie Barnes managed just nine points on 3-for-14 shooting and recorded a game-worst minus-33 rating.
Immanuel Quickley left the game in the second quarter with a right pelvic injury while leading the team with 13 points.
Rookie Jamal Shead led the quartet of first-timers with 10 points and four assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic expressed pride in his team's overall effort and the opportunity for four rookies to make their NBA debuts.

Rajakovic commented on Scottie Barnes' performance, stating, 'It's one night, one game. We all believe in Scottie and know what kind of player he is and how he will contribute to the team. He will be just fine.'
Rajakovic reflected on the emotions and the start of a long journey for the team, especially for the rookies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sold-out crowd of 19,800 fans, including former Raptors players from the past 29 seasons and recently inducted Hall of Famer Vince Carter, filled the arena.
